New Records: Fakhar Zaman needs ten runs to complete the landmark of 5000 runs in international cricket.
Haris Rauf needs just one scalp to reach 150 wickets in international matches.
Mitchell Santner requires four scalps to get to 250 wickets across formats.
Trent Boult needs two wickets to reach 600 scalps in international cricket.
Lockie Ferguson requires three scalps to get to 100 wickets in the ODI format.
Tom Latham requires 52 runs to complete the milestone of 4000 runs in ODI cricket.
Kyle Jamieson needs four scalps to reach 100 wickets in international matches.
James Neesham is six sixes away from completing 100 maximums across formats.
Hasan Ali is one scalp away from reaching 100 wickets in one-day internationals.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand is struggling with injuries, with Matt Henry ruled out due to a hamstring injury.
Pakistan has returned to winning ways after defeating Bangladesh.
Both teams are desperate for a win to stay in the competition.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan has the upper hand over New Zealand with 7 victories in 9 WC matches.
The match will take place on a doubleheader Saturday, November 04, 2023, at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bangalore.
Others: New Zealand has won 51 matches against Pakistan in 115 ODI encounters.
